thread.title: Former Perry wrestling coach Riggs receives national honor
thread.title_full: Former Perry wrestling coach Riggs receives national honor

author: CantonRep.com staff report
title: Former Perry wrestling coach Riggs receives national honor
text: Former Perry wrestling coach Riggs receives national honor Former Perry High School wrestling coach Dave Riggs was inducted into the Ohio Chapter of the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on Sunday. Comment Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:15 AM By CantonRep.com staff report Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:15 AM Former Perry High School wrestling coach Dave Riggs was inducted into the Ohio Chapter of the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on Sunday. Riggs, who retired after last season, was honored in particular for his 29 years of service as the Panthers head coach. He turned Perry into a national power in his tenure, leading the Panthers to 26 Top 10 finishes at the state tournament, nine state runner-up efforts and the 2014 Ohio Division I titles in the team and individual state tournaments. Under Riggsâ€™ tutelage Perry wrestlers had 30 individuals claim state championships and 106 state placers. Riggs posted a 282-47-1 overall record as head coach that included 21 Federal League championships and a 195-16-1 league record. He was inducted into the Stark County Wrestling Hall of Fame in June. By CantonRep.com staff report
